intro: Huttonella curta, commonly known as the short-stemmed huttonella, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its compact, upright growth habit. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish or brownish in color. It is adapted to arid conditions and has a shallow root system to maximize water absorption. Huttonella curta is often found in sagebrush communities and is an important component of its ecosystem.
